title: Renewing your lorry, bus or minibus driving licence

body.content:
Find out when and how to renew your lorry, bus or minibus driving licence depending on your age and what type of licence you have.

The process is different in [Northern Ireland.](http://www.nidirect.gov.uk/index/information-and-services/motoring/driver-licensing/need-a-new-or-updated-licence/renewing-your-driving-licence.htm)

Find out when and how to renew your lorry, bus or minibus driving licence depending on your age and what type of licence you have.

The process is different in Northern Ireland.

body.content:
You then need to do this every 5 years up until you’re 45, then different rules apply.

##When you get the form

DVLA will send you the form to sign and return XX days before your licence runs out.

Fill in the form and send it to DVLA.

$C
DVLA  
Swansea  
SA99 1BR  
$C

nodes.title: You need to sign a declaration to show you still meet the medical standards when your licence runs out.

body.content:
You then need to do this every 5 years up until you’re 45, then different rules apply.

##When you get the form

DVLA will send you the form to sign and return XX days before your licence runs out.

##Changing your name

To change your name you also need to send:

* a completed form D2 ‘[Application for a driving licence for a lorry, minibus or bus](/dvlaforms)’
* [original documents](driving-licence-application-identity-documents) confirming your change of name

$C
DVLA  
Swansea  
SA99 1BR  
$C

You then need to do this every 5 years up until you’re 45, then different rules apply.

When you get the form

DVLA will send you the form to sign and return XX days before your licence runs out.

Changing your name

To change your name you also need to send:

  • a completed form D2 ‘Application for a driving licence for a lorry, minibus or bus’
  • original documents confirming your change of name

DVLA
Swansea
SA99 1BR

##If you drive professionally

You need to [swap your paper licence for a photocard licence](/exchange-paper-driving-licence) to get your Driver Certificate of Professional (CPC) card to keep driving professionally.

You then need to do this every 5 years up until you’re 45, then different rules apply.

nodes.title: You need to renew your driving licence every 5 years.

body.content:
You’ll get 2 forms from DVLA 56 days before your driving licence runs out:

- an ‘application for renewal of lorry and bus entitlement’ (D47P)
- a ‘medical examination report’ form (D4)

##How to apply

s1. Fill in form D47P.
s2. Ask a doctor to fill in the medical examination report (form D4) - you might need to get an optician to fill in the vision assessment section if the doctor can’t do it. You can also use a private company specialising in driver medical exams. 
s3. Send the forms to DVLA.

$C
DVLA  
Swansea  
SA99 1BR  
$C

You can [order forms D2 and D4](/dvlaforms) from DVLA if they don’t arrive. 

##If you need to change the photo
A message on your D47P form will tell you if a photo is needed with your application.
If so, you’ll need to include a new passport type photo.

##When to expect your licence
You should get your licence within 3 weeks of DVLA receiving your application. It’ll take longer if your health or personal details have to be checked.

##Driving before your licence is returned
You can drive while your licence is being renewed if you meet all the following conditions:

- you have the support of your doctor to continue driving
- you had a valid licence
- you only drive under the conditions of the previous licence
- your application is less than a year old
- your last licence wasn’t revoked or refused for medical reasons
- you’re not currently disqualified
- you weren’t disqualified as a [high risk offender](/reapply-licence-revoked) on or after 1 June 2013

Read the guidance [‘Can I drive while my application is with DVLA?’](/government/publications/inf1886-can-i-drive-while-my-application-is-with-dvla) for more information.

You’ll get 2 forms from DVLA 56 days before your driving licence runs out:

  • an ‘application for renewal of lorry and bus entitlement’ (D47P)

How to apply

  2. Ask a doctor to fill in the medical examination report (form D4) - you might need to get an optician to fill in the vision assessment section if the doctor can’t do it. You can also use a private company specialising in driver medical exams.

  3. Send the forms to DVLA.

DVLA
Swansea
SA99 1BR

You can order forms D2 and D4 from DVLA if they don’t arrive.

If you need to change the photo

A message on your D47P form will tell you if a photo is needed with your application. If so, you’ll need to include a new passport type photo.

When to expect your licence

You should get your licence within 3 weeks of DVLA receiving your application. It’ll take longer if your health or personal details have to be checked.

Driving before your licence is returned

You can drive while your licence is being renewed if you meet all the following conditions:

  • you have the support of your doctor to continue driving
  • you had a valid licence
  • you only drive under the conditions of the previous licence
  • your application is less than a year old
  • your last licence wasn’t revoked or refused for medical reasons
  • you’re not currently disqualified
  • you weren’t disqualified as a high risk offender on or after 1 June 2013

Read the guidance ‘Can I drive while my application is with DVLA?’ for more information.

Read the guidance [‘Can I drive while my application is with DVLA?’](/government/publications/inf1886-can-i-drive-while-my-application-is-with-dvla) for more information.

You’ll get 2 forms from DVLA 56 days before your driving licence runs out:

  • an ‘application for renewal of lorry and bus entitlement’ (D47P)
  • a ‘medical examination report’ form (D4)

How to apply

  1. Fill in form D47P.

  2. Ask a doctor to fill in the medical examination report (form D4) - you might need to get an optician to fill in the vision assessment section if the doctor can’t do it. You can also use a private company specialising in driver medical exams.

  3. Send the forms to DVLA.

DVLA
Swansea
SA99 1BR

You can order forms D2 and D4 from DVLA if they don’t arrive.

If you drive professionally

You need to swap your paper licence for a photocard licence to get your Driver Certificate of Professional (CPC) card to keep driving professionally.

When to expect your licence

You should get your licence within 3 weeks of DVLA receiving your application. It’ll take longer if your health or personal details have to be checked.

Driving before your licence is returned

You can drive while your licence is being renewed if you meet all the following conditions:

  • you have the support of your doctor to continue driving
  • you had a valid licence
  • you only drive under the conditions of the previous licence
  • your application is less than a year old
  • your last licence wasn’t revoked or refused for medical reasons
  • you’re not currently disqualified
  • you weren’t disqualified as a high risk offender on or after 1 June 2013

Read the guidance ‘Can I drive while my application is with DVLA?’ for more information.

nodes.title: You need to renew your driving licence every year.

body.content:
You’ll get 2 forms from DVLA 56 days before your driving licence runs out:

- an ‘application for renewal of lorry and bus entitlement’ (D47P)
- a ‘medical examination report’ form (D4)

##How to apply

s1. Fill in form D47P.
s2. Ask a doctor to fill in the medical examination report (form D4) - you might need to get an optician to fill in the vision assessment section if the doctor can’t do it. You can also use a private company specialising in driver medical exams. 
s3. Send the forms to DVLA.

$C
DVLA  
Swansea  
SA99 1BR  
$C

You can [order forms D2 and D4](/dvlaforms) from DVLA if they don’t arrive. 

##If you drive professionally

You need to [swap your paper licence for a photocard licence](/exchange-paper-driving-licence) to get your Driver Certificate of Professional (CPC) card to keep driving professionally.

##When to expect your licence
You should get your licence within 3 weeks of DVLA receiving your application. It’ll take longer if your health or personal details have to be checked.

##Driving before your licence is returned
You can drive while your licence is being renewed if you meet all the following conditions:

- you have the support of your doctor to continue driving
- you had a valid licence
- you only drive under the conditions of the previous licence
- your application is less than a year old
- your last licence wasn’t revoked or refused for medical reasons
- you’re not currently disqualified
- you weren’t disqualified as a [high risk offender](/reapply-licence-revoked) on or after 1 June 2013

Read the guidance [‘Can I drive while my application is with DVLA?’](/government/publications/inf1886-can-i-drive-while-my-application-is-with-dvla) for more information.
